intro: Pentacalia flocculidens, commonly known as the woolly pentacalia, is a flowering plant native to South America. It belongs to the family Campanulaceae and is characterized by its distinctive, woolly, and often hairy foliage. The plant produces small, bell-shaped flowers that are typically white or pale blue in color. It thrives in humid, shaded environments and is often found in tropical and subtropical regions. Due to its unique appearance and ornamental value, it is occasionally cultivated in botanical gardens and by plant enthusiasts.
